meanings.sent1: The little boy faced a hitch in his plan to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: The team overcame the hitch in their project by working together.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had a small hitch when they forgot the drinks.
meanings.sent4: The plan hit a hitch when the main speaker got stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent5: Despite the hitch, they managed to finish the race on time.

meanings.definition: To fasten or attach with a knot or hook
meanings.sent1: She had to hitch the trailer to the car before they could leave.
meanings.sent2: He decided to hitch the rope securely to the post.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy tried to hitch his horse but it kept wandering off.
meanings.sent4: She managed to hitch the tent to a tree to keep it from blowing away.
meanings.sent5: He had to hitch the boat to the dock to keep it from drifting away.

meanings.sent1: The sudden hitch of the car made everyone jolt forward.
meanings.sent2: She felt a hitch in her shoulder when she lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The comedian added a funny hitch to his dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The hitch in the music made it hard to keep dancing smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The hitch in the road caused the bus to bounce uncomfortably.

meanings.definition: To move or pull with a jerk
meanings.sent1: He had to hitch the stubborn donkey along the path.
meanings.sent2: She tried to hitch the suitcase up the stairs but it was too heavy.
meanings.sent3: The old truck would often hitch when accelerating.
meanings.sent4: She had to hitch the dog away from the cat before they fought.
meanings.sent5: The boat hitched along the waves as the storm grew stronger.
